citeinfo.title: HERE 2020 Q3 POI Points for: Southern Caribbean in File Geodatabase Format

descript.abstract: The Points of Interest (POI File Geodatabase Feature Class) point layer contains a wide variety of attributes for many types of point locations. These include name, category, address, retail chain, cusine type, along with other data fields.
descript.purpose: Road network navigation and routing, geocoding, location-based services, and base mapping applications.

idinfo.accconst: Access to this data is allowed only to HERE customers, as detailed specifically in HERE licensing terms and agreements.
idinfo.useconst: Use of this data is allowed only to HERE customers, as detailed specifically in HERE licensing terms and agreements.
idinfo.datacred: HERE incorporates and enhances data from a number of local governments, utility companies, other public agencies, and commercial mapping agencies in building its final products.

attracc.attraccr: HERE advanced map-building capabilities, local field staff and a fleet of LIDAR equipped TRUE vehicles capture the world down to centimeter level precision to build a virtual 3D model of the real world. In addition, internal test applications are regularly run on attributes to assist in verification and correction.

dataqual.logic: HERE publishes Technical Notification Memorandums (TNM) for customers on a quarterly and weekly basis via HERE TNM Web Portal. These TNMs include information pertaining to product updates, format changes, new attributes, detailed attribute specifications and representations, and new country coverage announcements. If HERE plans to add, remove, or change an attribute or product Layer, an announcement is made to customers a minimum of 6 months in advance. This allows customers to prepare and make necessary modifications to their applications before a new attribute is released in the product.
dataqual.complete: HERE includes 4 levels of street map coverage: Prime, Complete, Network, and City-to-City. Prime is HERE's highest level of coverage. This coverage level has the most detail and enables door-to-door routing functionality. Complete is a level of coverage, which is source dependent. It is the coverage level used for links that are not field verified and are flagged with the In-Process Data attribute = Y. Network coverage includes the main highway network and all the necessary attributes required to allow routing from city to city. Network links are coded with Detailed City Inclusion attribute = N and In-Process Data attribute = N. For Network links, the Full Geometry flag may be set to either yes or no depending on the presence or lack of surrounding In-Process Data Coverage. The City-to-City specification enables HERE to maintain minimum coverage in areas prior to completing Prime, Network, or In- Process areas. Examples include: major roads only in a country where there is no existing coverage, major roads to a city in a country where there is currently no other existing coverage, or major roads between existing DC/Prime, IT/Network, or In-Process areas. In many countries, HERE has used a commercial source to add local roads to the Inter-Town network. The inclusion of this geometry allows improved map display and guidance. This coverage level is called Full Coverage in the U.S. and Road Network Coverage in Europe. The Connector Specification enables HERE to maintain minimum coverage in areas prior to completing (full) Prime, Network/Inter Town (IT), or In-Process areas. For defining a hierarchical network used to determine a logical and efficient route for a traveler, each map street segment is tagged with a 5 level Functional Class (FC) attribute explained as follows. FC 1: Very long distance routes between major cities - The "highest level" network comprises the FC 1 arterials, which are primarily controlled access highways designed for very-long-distance travel linking major metropolitan areas and cities, FC 2: Primary routes between major and smaller cities and through metro areas, FC 3: Major routes between minor cities or towns, and through city districts, FC 4: Routes connecting minor towns or villages and collecting the local traffic in the city districts, and FC 5: Roads that are not efficient through routes - The "lowest level" and final category is FC 5, which comprises roads not considered to be arterials or transportation corridors.

horizpa.horizpar: The position of POI data is determined through a geocoding process, using linear interpolation along a street segment. Positions are therefore relatively accurate along the segment, but may not necessarily fall on the exact physical location of the POI.

procstep.procdesc: HERE File Geodatabase Plus is assembled from the following data sources: HERE North America FGDB, HERE Traffic Patterns, HERE Postal Code Boundaries, and HERE enhanced network routing and geocoding data entities and locators.

Using proprietary tools and processes, HERE collects road geometry and approximately 400 road attributes. Proprietary software is used to add navigable information, addresses, and points of interest. TRUE vehicles and photos capture overhead signage to ensure that the data accurately reflects the real world.

HERE relies on local source data and input from map users to generate constant daily map updates, such as real time traffic, turn by turn directions, public transportation routes and information about local business and attractions.
HERE allows end users to update map content through the HERE Map Creator program, which provides online cartographic and data editing capabilities (https://mapcreator.here.com).

enttyp.enttypd: The Points of Interest (POI File Geodatabase Feature Class) point layer contains a wide variety of attributes for many types of point locations. These include name, category, address, retail chain, cusine type, along with other data fields.

attr.attrdef: Object ID - ESRI unique ID.

attrdomv.udom: The set of all OBJECTID values

attr.attrdef: Shape - ESRI geometry object.

attrdomv.udom: The set of all SHAPE values

attr.attrdef: POI ID - Unique ID for the POI.

attrdomv.udom: The set of all POI_ID values

attr.attrdef: Category ID - The Category ID defines the type of POI.

ISO Country Code - A three-letter country code as defined by the International Organization for Standardization. The ISO Country Code indicates in which country the feature is located. Different layers describe different features. ISO Country Code attribution is applied to Navigable Links, Administrative Hierarchies, and POIs in various layers.

Language Code - The language associated with the feature name. The Language Code, in conjunction with Prefix, Feature Name, Street Type, and Suffix, can be used in destination selection, route guidance, and map display.
Poi Name - The POI Name is the Preferred, Official Name of the POI. POI Names can be used for destination selection and map display for languages supported by HERE.

attrdomv.udom: The set of all POI_NAME values

attr.attrdef: House Number - The House Number is the House Number of the POI.

attrdomv.udom: The set of all HOUSE_NUMBER values

attr.attrdef: Full House Number - The Full House Number is the Full POI House Number of the POI.

attrdomv.udom: The set of all FULL_HOUSE_NUMBER values

attr.attrdef: Actual Address - The Actual Address represents the full actual address of the POI but it is different from the street address where the entrance of the POI is physically located. Actual Address allows the actual address of a POI to be displayed when the POI entrance is not physically located at that address.

attrdomv.udom: The set of all ACTUAL_ADDRESS values

attr.attrdef: Actual City - The Actual City is the parsed Actual City Name of the POI.

attrdomv.udom: The set of all ACTUAL_CITY values

attr.attrdef: Actual Postal Code - The Actual Postal Code is the parsed Actual Postal Code of the POI.

attrdomv.udom: The set of all ACTUAL_POSTCODE values

attr.attrdef: Actual Street Name - The Actual Street Name is the parsed Actual Street Name of the POI.

attrdomv.udom: The set of all ACTUAL_STREET_NAME values

attr.attrdef: Actual House Number - The Actual House Number is the parsed Actual House Number of the POI.

attrdomv.udom: The set of all ACTUAL_HOUSE_NUMBER values

attr.attrdef: Vanity City ID - The Vanity City ID is the Admin Place ID representing the Vanity City of the POI. Key into the Admin table.

attrdomv.udom: The set of all VANITY_CITY_ID values

attr.attrdef: Display ID - The Display ID is a value which can be used for map display to render POIs in a logical manner.

attrdomv.udom: The set of all DISPLAY_ID values

attr.attrdef: Link ID - Unique identifier for the Link to which the Street Address relates. Link ID is used to identify each link in the database.

attrdomv.udom: The set of all LINK_ID values

attr.attrdef: Side - The Side of the link where the POI is located.
Street Address ID - Unique identifier for a named, addressed navigable link.

attrdomv.udom: The set of all STREET_ADDRESS_ID values

attr.attrdef: Admin Place ID - The Admin Place ID is a unique identifier of the lowest administrative level in the hierarchy.

attrdomv.udom: The set of all ADMIN_PLACE_ID values

attr.attrdef: Postal Code - Provides the Postal Code area in which the POI is located.While this feature can be used for destination selection this is usually not recommended, except in the case of refined address resolution. For example, when the same address exists twice within a city, a postal code selection may narrow down which address is preferred.

attrdomv.udom: The set of all POSTAL_CODE values

attr.attrdef: Percent From Reference Node - Percent From Reference Node is an attribute to a Point Of Interest (POI) and indicates the location of the POI on the link in terms of percent from the reference node. POI Percent from Reference Node can be used to determine icon placement and timing of guidance information. This is particularly useful when POIs do not have an address, the road does not carry addresses, or when the POI is located on a very long link.

attrdomv.udom: The set of all PERCENT_FROM_REF values

attr.attrdef: Display Latitude - The Display Latitude is the latitude of the display position of the POI.

attrdomv.udom: The set of all DISPLAY_LAT values

attr.attrdef: Display Longitude - The Display Longitude is the longitude of the display position of the POI.

attrdomv.udom: The set of all DISPLAY_LON values

attr.attrdef: National Importance - National Importance indicates if a POI is nationally important. Nationally important means that the POI name is recognisable without a city name. For example, Heathrow Airport is recognisable without the city name of London. For systems that require city input first, National Importance allows display of regionally prominent POIs in a scroll list without needing to identify the city name.

Private - Identifies roads not maintained by an organization responsible for maintenance of public roads. Private allows for unique cartographic representation of roads that restrict public use. This attribute could also affect routing algorithms by assigning higher penalties to unpaved roads.

Cuisine Type - Defines the predominant Cuisine Type applicable to the restaurant POI by giving a textual description of the cuisine type. Implementation of Cuisine Type allows a user to select restaurants by desired food type. Cuisine Type enables restaurants to be indexed, queried, and displayed by cuisine type.

attrdomv.udom: The set of all CUISINE_TYPE values

attr.attrdef: Chain Name - Chain Name defines the predominant Chain Name for the POI.

attrdomv.udom: The set of all CHAIN_NAME values

attr.attrdef: Location Score - Location Score provides a percentage value indicating the confidence of location accuracy. The Location Score ranges in value from 0 - 100.

attrdomv.udom: The set of all LOCATION_SCORE values

attr.attrdef: Place Score - Place Score provides a percentage value indicating the completeness of POI attribution. The Place Score ranges in value from 0 - 100.

attrdomv.udom: The set of all PLACE_SCORE values

attr.attrdef: Calculated Level - Calculated Level indicates the overall level of completion and accuracy of a POI. The Calculated Level ranges from 1-4.
Entrance Type - Entrance Type identifies the type of entrance to a facility. Entrance Type can be used for destination selection and map display to identify preferred entrances to a POI.

attrdomv.udom: The set of all ENTRANCE_TYPE values

attr.attrdef: In Vicinity - The In Vicinity attribute identifies whether a POI has been associated with a road representing its true location, or on a road nearby due to Inter-Town/Network road inclusion levels. The attribute tells a system what kind of route guidance information should be provided to users. If the POI is not In Vicinity the system can state 'you have arrived'. If the POI is In vicinity, the system can tell the user the POI is nearby but that further routing advice is not available.

Display Class - Display Class is a classification of features that enables a meaningful display of these specific features.The classification is assigned according to the importance of the associated feature. Display Class information can be used to determine which features to display at different zoom levels. Display Class information can be used to prune out icons/landmarks of lower importance for memory-limited devices. Note: Display Class definitions for hydro-graphic features use different criteria for individual classes than Display Class for Landmarks/POIs.

distinfo.resdesc: HERE product file, multi-zip file packages in ESRI File Geodatabase format.
distinfo.distliab: This data can only be distributed to HERE customers, as detailed specifically in our licensing terms and agreements.

networka.networkr: https://HERE.flexnetoperations.com. requiring username and password as issued to customer by HERE. Immediate, easy, and secure download access for data and documentation through HERE's B2B website is the data delivery method. HERE customers also receive email notification when new releases or updates become available for data and documentation.

stdorder.fees: Contact Sales for most current pricing information.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
